content: The RMS Titanic tragically sank on its maiden voyage in 1912 after hitting what type of natural obstacle?

The RMS Titanic tragically sank on its maiden voyage in 1912 after hitting an iceberg in the North Atlantic Ocean. The collision occurred on the night of April 14, 1912, and the ship sank early the next morning, resulting in the loss of over 1,500 lives. The disaster remains one of the most infamous maritime tragedies in history.
